alert.note: Alert for Arenac (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 4:06PM EDT until March 26 at 1:01PM EDT by NWS Gaylord
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gaylord MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Rifle River near Sterling affecting Arenac County. For the Rifle River...including Sterling...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rifle River near Sterling. * WHEN...From this afternoon to early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, High water begins to impact canoe livery at River View Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 5.8 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise to 6.0 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall to 5.9 feet and begin rising again tomorrow evening. It will rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue to rise to 7.5 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 6.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.5 feet on 03/31/1979. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (2 pm EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Rifle River Sterling 6.0 5.8 Tue 3 pm EDT 6.0 6.7 7.3 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 415 AM EDT.
